full_text: OQS - Viewing Case Number 06049528 Page 2 of 3 CASE NO. 06049528 PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE OFFENSE REPORT CASE NO. DEPOSITION: CLEARED BY REPORT NUMBER: 1 FLORIDA VICTIM ? N WEATHER: CLEAR WITNESS TO CRIME KNOWN ? Y CAR VICTIM I.D. SUSPECT ? Y WILL VICTIM PROSECUTE ? Y IS M.O. SIGNIFICANT ? Y LAYENTS LIFTED ? N TAG NUMBER KNOWN ? N ARRESTING OFFICER .... D/S SHAFFER/ID 6376 SUSPECT NAME KNOWN ? Y SUSPECT LOCATION KNOWN ? Y STOLEN PROPERTY TRACEABLE ? N EVIDENCE LEFT AT SCENE ? N SUSPECT'S VEHICLE KNOWN ? N PROPERTY DAMAGE ? N ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION. I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, HAD FOUND THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT. UPON MY ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE, REPORTED THAT HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT. THEN STATED THAT AROUND 5:45 AM OF TODAY'S DATE, HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING OUT ALL NIGHT STATED THAT HE BELIEVES THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE BLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILATED. STATED THAT GOT DRESSED AND HE DROPPED HER OFF AT SCHOOL, HOWEVER, A SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, CALLED HIM IN ORDER TO CHECK ON HER BECAUSE SHE WAS BELIEVED TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NARCOTICS. DURING THEIR DRIVE FROM THE SCHOOL BACK TO THEIR RESIDENCE, CONTINUOUSLY SAID HOW MUCH SHE HATED HIM AND WISHED THAT HE WOULD DIE. UPON ENTERING THE RESIDENCE, SHE CONTINUED SCREAMING PROFANITIES AT HIM AND STATED THAT SHE WOULD RUN AWAY. STATED THAT HE THEN SHUT HER BEDROOM DOOR AND SAID YOU CAN MAKE A CHOICE, STAY HERE OR LEAVE THE HOUSE. THEN STATED AT THIS TIME, BEGAN TO SWING HER ARMS AND FIST WILDLY AT HIM, STRIKING HIM SEVERAL TIMES IN THE LEFT AND RIGHT FOREARM AND IN THE CHEST, SCREAMING THAT SHE HATED HIM AND WANTED HIM TO DIE. printed by Employee Id #: 4541 on April 05, 2006 04 http://oqs.pbso.org/index.cfm?fa=dspCase&fromrec=1&srhta=d67d417bd0daee93-6BB4D0t... 4/5/2006 07/26/17 Page 69 of 95 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031066

text_blocks.content: OQS - Viewing Case Number 06049528 Page 2 of 3
PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE OFFENSE REPORT

REPORT NUMBER: 1 FLORIDA VICTIM ? N WEATHER: CLEAR WITNESS TO CRIME KNOWN ? Y CAR VICTIM I.D. SUSPECT ? Y WILL VICTIM PROSECUTE ? Y IS M.O. SIGNIFICANT ? Y LAYENTS LIFTED ? N TAG NUMBER KNOWN ? N ARRESTING OFFICER .... D/S SHAFFER/ID 6376 SUSPECT NAME KNOWN ? Y SUSPECT LOCATION KNOWN ? Y STOLEN PROPERTY TRACEABLE ? N EVIDENCE LEFT AT SCENE ? N SUSPECT'S VEHICLE KNOWN ? N PROPERTY DAMAGE ? N

ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION. I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, HAD FOUND THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT. UPON MY ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE, REPORTED THAT HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT. THEN STATED THAT AROUND 5:45 AM OF TODAY'S DATE, HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING OUT ALL NIGHT STATED THAT HE BELIEVES THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE BLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILATED. STATED THAT GOT DRESSED AND HE DROPPED HER OFF AT SCHOOL, HOWEVER, A SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, CALLED HIM IN ORDER TO CHECK ON HER BECAUSE SHE WAS BELIEVED TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NARCOTICS. DURING THEIR DRIVE FROM THE SCHOOL BACK TO THEIR RESIDENCE, CONTINUOUSLY SAID HOW MUCH SHE HATED HIM AND WISHED THAT HE WOULD DIE. UPON ENTERING THE RESIDENCE, SHE CONTINUED SCREAMING PROFANITIES AT HIM AND STATED THAT SHE WOULD RUN AWAY. STATED THAT HE THEN SHUT HER BEDROOM DOOR AND SAID YOU CAN MAKE A CHOICE, STAY HERE OR LEAVE THE HOUSE. THEN STATED AT THIS TIME, BEGAN TO SWING HER ARMS AND FIST WILDLY AT HIM, STRIKING HIM SEVERAL TIMES IN THE LEFT AND RIGHT FOREARM AND IN THE CHEST, SCREAMING THAT SHE HATED HIM AND WANTED HIM TO DIE.
printed by Employee Id #: 4541 on April 05, 2006 04
07/26/17 Page 69 of 95 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031066

additional_notes: The document appears to be a scanned copy of an offense report from the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office. The report details a missing person investigation and a subsequent altercation between the victim's father and the victim. The document is typed and contains no handwritten notes or stamps.
